    level="1"
    right="Feat 4"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Safe House](/Feats.aspx?ID=6427) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=535" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=227) pg. 219 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Archetype** [Vigilante](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=267)

**Prerequisites**
[Vigilante Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=6424)

</column>

---

You establish a safe house—a secure space in which to hide your secrets from the outside world. This safe house is roughly the size of two 10-foot cubes. It's in a location you have access to, and it can be part of a larger building or structure, like a hidden room or an underground cave. The safe house protects objects and people inside it from magical detection. This has the effects of [_veil of privacy_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1739), using your [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=38) modifier for the [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=2250) DC and half your level rounded up for the counteract rank. Setting up or moving your safe house takes a week of downtime. The size of the safe house expands to four 10-foot cubes if you're an expert in [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=38), eight cubes if you're a master, and 16 cubes if you're legendary.
